title: Which Came First? Winner of Best Children's Book at the 2017 North Texas Book Festival!
features: Don't be a chicken liver...don't be a chicken liver...don't be a chicken liver... Which Came First?, is a story about learning to face our fears and not giving up, even when we feel like a chicken liver. It's also a story about the gentle bonds of love and trust between grandparents and grandchildren. After much effort, the girl in the story comes up with a clever and resourceful way to accomplish the task her grandmother has asked her to do. Written with humor and accompanied by delightful illustrations, Which Came First?, is a story every child, parent, and grandparent will enjoy reading together!
description: A delightful, heartwarming story told through the eyes of an adorable 9 year old bandit in a red bandana. Facing your fears has never been so suspenseful, artfully illustrated, and amusing! This is a wonderful, timeless story for the child in all of us. Which Came First? will give you something to crow about! --Galyn Barnum, Portage, MichiganThis is a great book for kids of all ages and parents will enjoy reading it too! Don't miss the fun facts about chickens and the funny chicken sayings after the story. --Paul Bolinger, Denton, Texas

Janet Sever Hull grew up in Elkhart, Indiana and is a graduate of Purdue University. She has been writing since the age of 16 and is the author of many stories. She was first published nationally in The School Press Review Magazine in November of 1977 when she was a senior in high school. That year, her story, From Tennis Team To Wheelchair Life, won a nationwide literary contest for high school students. Which Came First? was published in April of 2016 and is the second book she has written. Her first book, The Button Box, was published in 2014. She and her husband, Jeff, live in Corinth, Texas and are the parents of four adult children. She is currently working on her third book with illustrator Vicki Killion Guess, about the day a turkey went to school. You may visit the author at janetseverhull.com
store: Janet Sever Hull (Author),  Vicki Killion Guess (Illustrator)
